docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Centers for Disease Control has recommended that AIDS and all other contagious diseases except tuberculosis be removed from a list of illnesses that is used to bar people from entering the country, Federal officials said.

headline.main: Agency Says AIDS Should Not Bar Entry to U.S.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Centers for Disease Control has recommended that AIDS and all other contagious diseases except tuberculosis be removed from a list of illnesses that is used to bar people from entering the country, Federal officials said.

byline.original: By PHILIP J. HILTS, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: INTERNATIONAL A2-10 Protesters across the Soviet Union thronged to the streets in at least 20 cities in a defiant call for a share of power. The demonstrations, organized by the country's pro-democracy opposition, were peaceful. Page A1
docs.snippet: LEAD:    INTERNATIONAL    A2-10       Protesters across the Soviet Union thronged to the streets in at least 20 cities in a defiant call for a share of power. The demonstrations, organized by the country's pro-democracy opposition, were peaceful.   ...

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ANN P. cringes at the thought of her 10-year-old daughter visiting the home of a particular friend. The problem lies not with the other child but with her parents, who have a strikingly different approach to supervising children.
